Rancho.Action: Continues to pursue education and opportunities despite initial academic setbacks and lack of marks to enter engineering.
Enrolls simultaneously in commerce and CA foundation courses but shows lack of interest in CA classes, calling them a waste of time.
Decides to be honest with his father about not wanting to pursue chartered accountancy, despite fear and uncertainty.
Does not immediately offer an alternative plan when rejecting the career path, showing vulnerability.
Carries on with a charade to avoid hurting his parents initially.
Tells his father he does not want to pursue chartered accountancy despite fear and uncertainty.
Carries on with the charade of studying something he does not want to do out of fear and societal expectations.
Runs to the terrace to fly kites with a silly grin symbolizing freedom and relief.
Devotes time to helping his father with the family business diligently and enthusiastically.
Joins the theatre group, participates actively, and shows interest in collective creative activities.
Merges his theatre group with another passionate group to form Awaaz, collaborates closely with others, and spends hours working on plays together.
Invites and learns from respected theatre personalities, showing respect and openness to others' expertise.
Meets regularly after busy schedules, using any available space to rehearse late into the night showing dedication and cooperation.
Focuses on producing theatre for passion rather than profit, diligently managing accounts and selling tickets to friends and relatives to cover costs.
Merged theatre groups to form a new group called Awaaz, demonstrating initiative and collaboration.
Spent hours translating plays from Bangla to Hindi, showing dedication and skill.
Invited acclaimed theatre personalities to direct plays, showing strategic thinking and respect for expertise.
Handled all aspects of theatre production including booking halls, sets, costumes, accounts, and ticketing, displaying strong organizational and management skills.
Maintained diligent accounts from theatre activities, indicating conscientiousness and financial responsibility.
Sold tickets primarily to friends and relatives despite theatre not being popular, showing realistic understanding of market and resourcefulness.
Makes a second attempt to get into FTII after initial failure, changes strategy by applying to a different course (editing instead of direction), and successfully gains admission.
Initially unaware of entrance exam format and process, showing lack of preparation leading to failure on first attempt.
Acknowledges naiveté and illusions about success after admission, showing self-awareness but also a gap in realistic expectations.
Rancho calls Raju and Farhan to meet him on time at a specific location, showing reliability and confidence in organizing a meeting.

Does not appear where expected, causing concern and confusion among friends.
Consistently maintains a calm and confident demeanor (implied from others' concern and Chatur's reaction).
Is the subject of a long search by friends who express hope and happiness at the prospect of seeing him again, indicating his significance and presumed competence.
Rancho is described as 'free as the wind,' 'like a soaring kite,' living carefree, touching others' hearts, and providing shade and oasis metaphors.
Carved a path of his own, stumbling and rising, living each moment to the fullest, touching friends' hearts with his unique approach.
Vanishes without clear explanation or communication to friends, leaving them uncertain about his whereabouts.
Described metaphorically as soothing balm to a bruised heart and like shade in scorching sun, an oasis in desert, fearless and frolicking against the tide, a dear friend despite being lonesome
